Hi Sachin,

On 11/15/05, sachin.dholakia@t=
cs.com <sachin.dholakia@...> wrote:
>
> Hi J.B,
>
> I am on the other s=
ide of the shore and believe in Code coverage and so
> very interested in k=
nowing why you feel that 100% code coverage isn't a
> requirement for code =
check in?  Can you please share your thoughts?


Nobody disputes that 100% =
code coverage is a good thing, it's just that it
becomes impossibly hard to=
 achieve as your code base becomes more complex.
You just need to make sure=
 you don't hit the point of diminishing return
when trying to hit a balance=
 between "more code coverage", "more tests",
"bug fixes" and "more features=
".

--
C=E9dric
http://testng.org
